Its a clock and its old !! Nah only joking its amazing,could we build the same today?. Steeped in the history of London,I am not a lover of touring old landmarks/buildings but this is a must !!☺☺☺☺
Iconic landmark. No visit to London would be complete with a sighting of this iconic landmark. There are many angles to photograph it from, but my favorite was from the London Eye.
An amazing sight!. Such an amazing sight! A must see on your trip to London. Wander around to see Big Ben from all angles and view Westminster Abbey and the Palace of Westminster too.

Day in London . Spend the day in London sight seeing, it was very hot so very busy, our first stop was Westminster so I could visit St Tomas hospital grounds to take photos of my hero Mary Seacole fabulous beautiful, walked around to Big Ben a most to hear and see, plenty of places to eat drink and sit.
London Highlight. You can not go to London without visiting Big Ben or any of the other main attractions of this city, which I reckon is the capital of the world
Amazing to see. Amazing to finally see Big Ben up close. Beautiful architecture of the tower itself and of the attached Parliament building.
Amazing in person!. So cool to get to see such an amazingly beautiful piece of history! There's tons of cool stuff to do all around Big Ben as well! ☺
Picturesque. One of London's most famous landmarks! Amazing architecture and definitely a must see when in London!
Beautiful!!!. Not only is Big Ben bigger than i expected, Parliament is magnificent! This is the most amazing architecture I have ever seen. Big Ben and Parliament should not be missed.
"Amazing Sight". This is a great tourist attraction. It's best to visit at night when the lights illuminate from the clock and the surrounding buildings.

Nothing here. My review is short and sweet...it's a clock! Big and iconic, but if you're from abroad what can you say but "wow" and that's it. I'm English so I give it 2 out of 5 for being iconic, but you seen it and that's it.

A must see while in London!. An icon of London which is worth seeing for sure! And it's so close to the Abbey, the Thames....you can cover it all in one visit. Make sure to be there on the hour for Big Ben's chimes!!

an eye for time. Big Ben is very famous for London.there are many sights in England that people will ask if you have seen.one of them is Big Ben.it is very central to all the sights around London.When i first was in London me and my family were asking everyone where Big Ben was, and it turned out we were standing right in front of it.It lights up the Thames, and is a very imposing building.I think the only significance of it is for telling time, at least that is all that i know.It is a good starting place to see the sights, and enjoy yourselves.

Gorgeously Spectacular. Absolutely a site to see. Much bigger than you can imagine!
Beautiful architecture and wonderful hourly chimes

The Backdrop of London. This is a beautiful clock tower. It is a famous landmark in London. When you stand next to it, you realize just how tall it is. A heads up to those of you visiting in the next year. We were told the tower is going to be covered soon for repairs and maintenance.

Tells you the time from a long way away. Really handy if you have forgotten your watch or mobile phone and need to know the time.
You can see Big Ben from quite a long way away and we enjoyed seeing it from our taxi this morning.
Recommend you to look at Big Ben when you are in London, especially if you don't know the time.

Romantic midnight stroll. One often sees the Big Ben in the day and it all looks very commercial and not really "special". However, come late night and the full view gets transformed.
Romantic, peaceful, a very private space. The fairy lights and walk by the Thames from the opposite side of London bridge, the view is very relaxing and a pleasure to watch!

Good to see. Big Ben and Parliament are a part of London one must see, impressive buildings and surrounding area, next to Westminster close to the London Eye, so you could tick all these things off your list in a 1/2 day easy to walk to from Trafalgar Square or catch the tube.

great pics at day or night!. The Big Ben is a huge, beautiful, architectural masterpiece. It is located next to the Houses of Parliament. You can easily reach it at Westminster station.The best photo spots are 1 or 2 blocks away, pick some of these, either at day or night:- From the Parliament Square garden, besides Great George St. There is also a good spot with a typical red phone booth crossing this street.- From Westminster bridge (at the opposite end) crossing the Tamesis.- From the Saint Thomas Hospital gardens and river bank.I recommend visiting Big Ben area for taking stunning pictures, and then you can easilly visit the Houses of Parliament (online booking recommended), Westmister Abbey (online booking recommended for jumping the lines) or the London Eye.
beutifull place. did enjoy visiting this, place, very nice. do recomend to visit it. best time to visit is evening, brilliant with all the lights

The clock. I don't know if you can get inside the building that Big Ben sits on top of but I can say the architecture was breathtaking. This is a definite must see if you are touring London. You usually can get a view of this from just about anywhere in the city.

A must to see in London. Impressive when viewed from above from the London Eye and equally so when viewed from the street. Make a point of hearing the bells chime every quarter of an hour. Next year the clock will be stopped for refurbishment.

Iconic. This is the iconic clock tower which stands next to the Houses of Parliament Actually it is the bell in the tower which is called big ben, the tower itself has been known as St Stephens tower, the clock tower and recently renamed Elizabeth TowerDespite being one of the world's most famous tourist attractions, the interior of the tower is not open to overseas visitors, though United Kingdom residents are able to arrange tours (well in advance) through their Member of Parliament.However, the tower currently has no lift, so those escorted must climb the 334 limestone stairs to the topOne of the most famous landmarks in London it can be seen from all over the south bankWorth seeing just because
Day out. Again had taken my niece and nephews out for the day in London they loved seeing houses of parliament big Ben London EYE long day but worth it

Yeas!!!! I'm in London!!!!!!!!!!!. The moment when you realize that you are in London. You have to see it , in daylight is stuning, but at night is just stunning to see it. Cross the river and enjoy the view.
This is a must. I was in London onlz for short visit, however this was a must and I had to go here. It was raining and still this was spectacular view.

A Truly Amazing Sight!. It is hard to explain the awe we felt when we emerged from the Westminster underground station and saw Big Ben right in front of us! A must-see destination if you are in London!

Amazing!. This is just an amazing building to see, the clock chimes every 15 minutes which is fantastic when you are walking to the city and don't have your phone or watch, and it just looks amazing! Worth to trip to get some photos. All you need is a good 5-10 minutes and move on to your next place.

Iconic must see. Even if you can't arrange a tour it's worth coming to see Big Ben and all the surrounding buildings. It's picture perfect from every angle and I have to say has some of the friendliest police officers on guard.Just take the tube to Westminster, Big Ben is right outside so it's hardly a hardship for anybody to add this to their visit to the capital.

A must for any trip to London!. It felt surreal to be standing by Big Ben, such an iconic symbol of London. We were lucky enough to be in the area a number of times during our visit and each time I was amazed that I was there. Took some wonderful pictures and got to hear it chime. It is a very busy area but it just adds to the atmosphere of the place. Make an effort to get here as you won't be disappointed.

See Big Ben then get on the Eye. Must see, awesome in person. Crowded place from westminster bridge (Metro stop nearby and people going to the EYE and Shrek adventure) during peak times. Just go to the other side of the Bridge!

A Classic. There can't be many more significant iconic London landmarks than Big Ben, recognised the world over just like Boris Johnson!Even as a long term Londoner, I'm continually proud and impressed whenever I walk by and see the throngs of tourists taking snaps. Makes one very proud to be British.

Your "Wow London!" Moment. From Heathrow Airport, find the train that would lead you to Westminster Station and the moment you would exit the station... Big Ben would be waiting for you outside. It's hard to describe the awesome experience but you'll know what I mean if you see it.
Awesome site. Always enjoy seeing Big Ben. Even saw it from the London Eye, this time. It's a must see, for anyone traveling to London.

Must see. Big Ben is a must see for all coming to London for the first time. However, de aware that it is a tower clock and that is all. The actual surroundings is much more interesting with much more to see.

World's Icon. What else can i say??
Go to London and not to see it?? No way! You have to see it, you have to hear it, you have to be next to it, you have to take pics with it...
Awesome. An experience not to be missed. The architecture is amazing. There was a great atmosphere around big ben, amazing to hear the clock chime.

site seeing . we went and had a look at big Ben still a lovely old clock to look at the area around the tourist attractions are very clean busy but clean we found the people who served us very helpful and polite
It is what it is. A Big Clock. Took my picture and moved on. I guess is something you must do when you visit London but don't expect to be blown away.
Amazing. The big gen is as amazing I imagined. Always full of tourists around and very accessible. A definitely 'must visit' place!

Amazing!. I was mesmerised! Simply amazing! We took many many pictures! I look at them now and wish I had more time for more sightseeing! It is definitely Something to remember! I always wanted to see the Big Ben upclose and was not at all disappointed! This trip was a dream coming true and I enjoyed everything..! I just loved London!
Way more detailed up close. Be sure to see Big Ben up close, it's so much more impressive when you get closer. Such an Iconic structure it was so nice to finally see it up close.

Beautiful. We arrived at Westminster on the tube and emerged on a sidewalk covered with thousands of people from every corner of the earth. There was Big Ben, right across the street from us. It is gorgeous, and looking like new after its recent rehab.We were lucky enough to be next to it when it struck twelve noon, so we heard all of its bongs. A neat experience.You can look at it from several angles, and the best view is from Westminster Bridge, right next to it. That way you can photograph it without five million people and a hundred double deckers in the way.

Absolutely amazing!!!. It's a site like no other. Every time I have family come over, it's one of the first attractions I take them to visit. No matter how many times you see it with your own eyes, it still puts an awe inspiring expression on my face.
Fun. We didnt go in because it was busy and I had the mother with. It is awesome to see in person though!
A London Icon. What can you say? Big Ben (the name of the bell, not the clock I believe) is a must see part of London. It is London, A London Icon not to be missed!

the most iconic site in London. Pop off the Tube at Westminster and you walk up the stairs to the sight your mind immediately sees when you think London. Very popular with tourists, beautiful during the day, but spectacular at night.
Must see when in London. Got a gotta go see when in London - it does what it says on the tin but definitely something you want to see when you're in London

Striking In All Weathers - Good For Selfys!. You can see Big Ben from the residents lounge in my favourite hotel in London (The Westminster Park Plaza). But there's nothing beats a walk across Westminster Bridge itself to get your photo taken with Big Ben in the background. Just be aware that almost every other tourist in London is usually trying to do the same thing - and so the north end of the bridge can become extremely crowded.It's worth a wander round to Parliament Square to see if you can get yourself on the evening news by walking past TV news people interviewing politicians. Try not to wave in the background though, these people have no sense of humour at all.Also remember that this part of London enjoys frequent demonstrations. Most of them are just people shouting and waving banners, the odd one can be a bit sinister to witness.
Listen to the strike every hour. We went to hear the strokes of 7 O'clock last night as sun going down, good photos and worth it to see.
Stunning area!. Big Ben and Parliament were beautiful. The area was crowded but worth the walk. I can see children getting bored easily. I'm glad I went for the photos.
A Must See. Just a Majestic Experience. A very worth place to see. You are taken aback by the sheer fullness of it.
Love big Ben. I always love to see big ben everytime I travel to London. Very British and an important iconic symbol. Free attraction to see in london.
A Lovely Little Visit.. A beautiful building to go and see. One of the many things you need to do if you ever visit London, alongside many of the other attractions!

Walked by. . So we just walked by and it was beautiful.
We didn't try to go in but I read somewhere you can't go inside unless you are a UK resident. Not sure if this is true but we didn't try.
But either way you need to see the outside.

Big Ben is not the Clock?. I learned that Big Ben is the bell in Elizabeth Tower. Quite a site to behold. I got to see this during our Fat Tire Bike Tour with Gerard. The stuff they used to do to people here.....quartering people! OMG.
You have to go around . It is a nice place to walk and take some pictures. There are many activists nearby including walking over the bridge to cross the Times and to go to London eye.

This is a must see! . I loved Big Ben. I think it is the monument that everyone recognizes even though they never saw it before. It represents London and after you see it you can walk through the Parliament or Westminster Abbey. It is a fantastic place for promenade during the day but also in the night. In order to see Big Ben from outside the cost is free. Nobody should miss this while in London. Also it is very easy to go there by public transport

Just as awesome as you would imagine. This is BIG BEN for God's sake. It is stunning, amazing, beautiful, awe-inspiring, and every other adjective you can think of. It's something you just walk by and photograph but even at that it's amazing. Walk the bridge so you get photos from every angle. You will not be disappointed. It's iconic and historic and simply a MUST SEE!!!

You can see it all over the city. If are on the tube and get off at Westminster station then it will be right in front of you. The tower is beautiful at night; if you are into photography, take a tripod and capture the image from the front of Westminster station.
It's a clock!. It's a huge clock that tells time. If you need to know what time it is, this thing is perfect for you.

Amazing View. Highly recommend taking pictures at night and from the London Eye. Spectacular! It's also great to walk by. If you like walking, it's not far from Trafalgar Square (about 10 minutes) on a perfect day.

London's most distinctive landmark. I live in London for years now. And Big Ben still amuses me everytime, all the time. Best part in starting your London tour is coming from Southbank and walking to Westminster Bridge towards Big Ben. OR Visit Westminster Cathedral first and walk to Big Ben from there. Walking is the best mode of transportation when you're in Central London. Or bus. Trains/Underground are convenient but London is a place for sightseeing and you won't see a thing if you're in the train.
An icon to visit. Call it mainstream, but you still have to visit this place. It's a great photo spot and it's at the bridge above Thames River.
Beautiful Site. lovely site especially for taking photo at night. Also it is a great historical site which i feel many persons should try to visit.
Must see. Definitely a sight to see - don't miss it when in London. Great history and lots to see and do. We loved it!

Big Ben!. It's a must even if you are just walking by! It is so close to the London Eye and lots of other sites. Great place and so much history. Try to go early in the morning before everyone else wakes up.
Iconic. Beautiful building, and great to see at any time of day in any weather... And it being right on the thames, it's a beautiful sight to see.

Weekend in London. One of the great landmark in England and is definitely worth visiting. There are plenty of tourist all year round. Make sure to bring with you a raincoat even in the summer as it can still be chilly and wet. No matter what season of the year you visit, you would still love it.

Never get tired of seeing it. Second trip to London and it's always exciting to see it. Hard not to though as you can view from many places and it's fun getting photos from all different angles. This time we saw it with a blue sky and this made it pop more.
What Time Is It?. Awesome! I love clocks already and to see this sticking up around the city ~ just really fun to walk around the city on a rainy day observing the sights. I LOVE LONDON!!
You can see the Clock Tower from everywhere... awesome. Found out that Big Ben is actually the name of the bell that rings the HOUR only, the rest is called the Elizabeth Tower, who knew?

Stunning . This is my view every-time I go to work. Every day is a different day to the views you experience over the Westminster bridge. The views you capture is Big Ben, the london eye, and Westminster. I just love it be it early morning, afternoon and night xIt does get busy so early early morning is the best time to visit especially for good selfies x
Amazing!!! . I loved it - it's a lot prettier at night time and you can get so many good photos of it! Definitely worth a visit to see Big Ben!
Can't help but see it. Standing tall and strong you can't miss Big Ben. Unobstructed photos can be hard get with everyone else also wanting the best picture. A must see for any visitor to London.
Magnificent structure. I am just in awe of this structure. Beautiful from all angles. Must see at dusk when the sun is setting on it.

WOW!!. An awesome sight. A must-see when in London. Be there at noon to hear all 12 bongs from the bell. Right next to Westminster Abbey and the Parliament buildings so there is lots to see in the area. Next time I'm there I'd like toi see it in the night.

Beautiful Bells. Really lets you know your in England to hear the bells toll and see everyone milling about. We were there during Brexit vote and the subsequent fallout so we saw a great deal of reporters. Elsewhere in the city no one seemed to care about anything but Euro Cup. Interesting!

Big Ben Tour. Big Ben tour went to the top of Big Ben ,There are 334 steps so you wont be able to go if your legs are bad ,Crutches are not allowed ,This tour is good when at the top you see Big Ben chime at the hour ,You stop a few times in rooms & the guide tells you about Big Ben also at the clock face you walk around the four faces on the inside of course , They give you ear plugs when it strikes as you can imagine its pretty loud ,If you go to the eleven o clock visit by the time you get to the top it is twelve o clock , ,This is a free visit but it can only be done through your MP , I booked in March for July as it was fully booked ,They only allow about 60 per day, Three visits a day approx. 20 persons per visit , But its well worth it a good visit ,You cannot go on the day ,Also you cannot take photos up Big Ben as they take your phone & camera away before you go on the visit ,Well worth a visit Excellent .
Classic!. Really classic spot in London, can't miss it. Try to be at some o'clock hour (XX:00) to listen the bells. Too bad it was not lighted at night, only the clock face.
Iconic. this is such a well known site and has to be worth a visit. It's easy to get to and there are many good places from which to get a good photo.
symbol of london. in london we can see from part the big ben love to see attractive can take good photos this is one of top place to see

Big Ben was fantastic. Nothing can quite prepare you for seeing Big Ben up and close. Bigger than initially thought. The Houses of Parliament were just as interesting and I didn't realise Big Ben is actually the name for the Bell inside the clock rather than the tower itself, which most assume it to be.
Iconic Tower. It is a very nice tower to see in person. We walked close by after seeing the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace.

It's nothing but a clock. I couldnt understand, what is all the hype about the big ben. It's nothing but a clock tower, right next to Westminster (British parliament), where everyone wants to get their picture clicked.

Look ..... ..... the Elizabeth Tower is an imposing struture BUT the sound of BIG BEN is a wonder .... I loved the BONGs . It was cool to be back in London to hear it cut the air - wonderful . If everybody had a Bhong when they heard Big Ben BONG London might be a more laid back place .... A very worthy landmark - shame about the Houses of Parliament .

The Symbol of Great Britain. Big Ben has always loomed large in the American view of Great Britain. No other edifice is synonymous with GB in a more prominent way. It is like the Statue of Liberty would be for non-Americans.

International symbol of Britain. Big Ben is the massive 14 ton bell named after Sir Benjamin Hall, Commissioner of Works when the bell was hung in 1858. The bell is struck on the hours as displayed on the largest clock in Britain( dials 23ft in diameter) which has been working since 1859. The clock tower at the corner of the Houses of Parliament at 320 feet high is not Big Ben, but is certainly the internationally recognized symbol of London as are the Westminster chimes a symbol of British culture around the world.
Best building in London . This has got to be the best building in London, I never tire of seeing it, such a beautiful structure, it has an enormous amount of history surrounding it.
It's a clock . It's ok nothing special really It's a clock at the end of the day. Can see it for miles around looks the same on all sides.

Best at night. Just walking across Westminster from the South Bank looking up at the clock faces is amazing then wandering around Parliament Square with the crowds of tourists, visitors and locals waiting for the clock to strike the hour is an amazing experience.

The 19 terrible out of 16,000 reviews made me laugh. Have a look, it's free.You can see it from almost anywhere in London.Lots of other stuff to see and do nearby.A must see for a newbie tourist .Pic of Schnauzer added.

Simply Amazing!. After leaving Westminster Station on exit 3 I faced this Big, Big Ben. Amazing architecture. Pay attention to all the details and you will be surprised how it could be built with such perfection in 1859.

Beautiful. Smaller than I expected. My favourite view was actually from the street right below, looking up at it. And I loved just spending time near it, listening to the hours chime off. So beautiful and peaceful.

"Midnight strike". As part of our anniversary break my husband took me to Big Ben to watch the clock strike midnight. A very nice romantic gesture. Even though it wasn't new year it still felt really special. I definitely think it's a must if visiting London.
Just great. There's no way you come to London and don't visit the Big Ben... The London Eye is just across the street! The best time to visit it is at sunset!
Amazing!. Superbly good a telling the time! Can catch you off guard with it's ridiculously loud chiming through out the day. A must see/hear when visiting the Big Smoke.
A great site to see . It is very busy but this area is amazing. You have the London Eye, Big Ben, and a few museums and small shops that are great for tourist! I would recommend this area to anyone!

Great visit in the heart of London. Big Ben is an iconic place and hence, a must see in London City. The place is very crowded and it is recommended to be there pretty early in the morning. Otherwise you'll be surrounded by thousands of tourists trying to get the best picture. The area around Big Ben is also worth a visit and it would be best to reserve 2-3 hours to stroll around in the morning before the buses come in and off-load the tourist groups.
Very nice. Imposing place, it´s worth to see it, even if it was overcrowded there. We loved the ringing the bell.

Big Ben is silent. Come on. Rate Big Ben? Are you serious?Every visitor should see the Elizabeth Tower and its clock, and every visitor will. You can't miss it: It looks just like its pictures.Strictly speaking, Big Ben is not the tower or the clock, but the great bell that strikes the hour. Visitors should know that for the next three years it and the clock's chimes have been silenced (except for important events) to allow for repairs. But you'll only miss that on the quarter-hour.

Great clock, classic chimes and history. This is an icon that deserves the name. The sound of its classic chimes evoke all sorts of memories of London, it's events and movies that feature it! Its location next to the Houses of Parliament and Westminster Abbey encapsulates so many historic events that it is a must see bucket list item. Pity that the security increases are inhibiting access and part of the experience - but that is modern life.

Awesome.. Fantastic...I would advise to take tube to Westminster and exit directly at foot of Big Ben...it's a terrific sight. Really busy...you're safer walking towards the Churchill statue and Westminister Abbey...best place for photos.
Big Ben. Very cool, had one day of sightseeing in London and started here. Very cool giant clock tower...way better than I imagined!

"Look kids, it's Big Ben" . Pretty much that's it. Best photos are from about half way across the bridge. No tours. Still it's beautiful. Elizabeth tower is the name of the clock tower. Big Ben is the chime. Great photo op
What I expected. The Big Ben is a London icon, and it is easy to locate. It is close to multiple other landmarks so it is great all of them at the same time.

Yes, It's Big Alright!. Big Ben has always been a London landmark and every I see a tall tower with a big clock even as a child, London comes to mind. This is across the street from the heavily populated pedestrians which is good because you don't really want to be up close.

Lovely view of Big Ben as you come out of Westminster station steps. Incase, you are traveling on the Red Line Underground and coming to Central London and get off at Westminster, you will get a lovely view of the Big Ben coming up from the Underground. As you walk along the street towards the Bridge, you can get lovely pictures of the Parliament House and Big Ben in the background.It was nice and sunny when we reached - mid - July , around 10am..then we walked to the London Eye booking office and got tickets to get a fantastic view of London from the eye.

BIG BEN IS THE BUSINESS. Yes this is a lovely giant timepiece and you cannot really miss it and it was built after The Palace of Westminister was destroyed by Fire in 1834. In 1844 it was decided the clock should be included in the new buildings for the Houses of Parliament ..There were two attempts at building the new bell. It has a fascinating history and there it stands tall today in all its glory. I have even been inside years ago and its very spectacular inside as well as outside and keeps perfect time.....a must see when you visit London and it is FREE,

Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. Come out of Westminster Tube station and behold the magnificent Big Ben. It takes your breath away. The beautiful and iconic London Landmark which you see clearly as you fly into Heathrow. A tour around the Houses of Parliament was a wonderful experience. The history surrounding this beautiful building and all the pomp and ceremony that goes with it. A privilege to be there at the making of history, Brexit.
Big Ben . Walking along the road toward Big Ben, we saw lots of beautiful building, continued walking u can walked to the London Eyes, lots of walking but love it
Favorite picture stop. Very crowded area of London. Took some awesome pictures of the river and Big Ben. Funny story about how it got its name. Be sure to find out.
WOW. great. such a good day and experience, highly recommend to anyone who visits London to go and see!!!

An amazing place to take photos. An amazing place to take photos. Hostorical place. Supported with all means of transportation. Buses and taxis. Plenty of tourists. Clean .close to Restaurants and souvenir shops.
Wonderful landmark. Big Ben is definitely a big landmark.and it is a must if you are a first time visitor to London,it is just a photo opportunity,we did not go inside not sure it is open to public.
Big Ben. On a coach tour when we saw this and as usual its only a taste of what you see. I was surprised that it wasn't as big as I thought is would be

Must see sight; use Rick Steves audio tour . My teens and I downloaded Rick Steves' Westminister Walk audio tour (free, get his app) and started at Parliament Square. Self-paced using our own earbuds, this is a great way to "tour" Whitehall from Parliament to Trafalgar. There are good photo opps with a classic phone booth and the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) in the background. We did not go inside Parliament. Tour was about 40 minutes.
A classic. Well what can I say, it's free to look at, it's in a fabulous picturesque area, and you can't visit London without seeing it!
Big Ben does not disappoint . Big Ben is probably England's most iconic landmark and it does not disappoint. It's all you've seen in movies and pictures and more. This is a must see!
Iconic. The area with Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and Parliment is a great afternoon and not to be missed. They are basically across the street from each other.

Great place to visit both day and night. There are some awesome picture opportunities from along the river as well as on the bridge. If you visit during the day, be sure to come back after dark to get some additional pictures with the lights on.The clock, of course, rings every quarter hour. Big Ben (the bell inside the tower) rings on the hour.

Not much to it, but impressive. I mean, it is what it is. It's Big Ben. We all know of it. It's England's iconic clock. That being said, it's beautifully maintained and up close it looks very impressive.

Can't help but see it. Not sure if I can really review Big Ben, if I just walked by it, and looked at it...and took plenty of pictures. However it is my understanding that you have to be a British Citizen to actually go in, so I guess my review is as good as I can do. But that said, if you don't see it you must have your head in the sand, because it's hard to miss, and everyone who comes to London should see it and get as close as possible. Oh yes, and you need to hear the bells chime at lest once as well.
Worth a look. We travelled to see it but had no time to go closer. Unsure if there are tours available. Located in very busy area but nice views
Perfect. Perfect architecture, amazing weather and great view. Beautiful monument in Westminster and the duty to visit everyone who came to London.

A must see site.. Just the most iconic site in London. Known the World over. Just standing beneath its shadow brings a feeling of pride in our country - much needed in these trying days. A must for every visitor to London.[Now called "The Elizabeth Tower" in honour of HM Queen's 90th Birthday, it houses the Great Bell of the clock, nicknamed "Big Ben".]

We saw it from many views. This is a must see if in London and the grand kids enjoyed it from the Eye, the river, the bus nad while walking around Whitehall. I wonder when they will make it into a digital clock?
Must be in London. I've been only in the neighbourhood, however recommend. Easy to Access from Victoria Station, few steps from Buckingham Pałace. Worth seeing!
Best time. If at all possible, try to visit big Ben at night time! Its fab! Also a lot less people, so plenty of time and space for photos etc!

A Great British Icon. I've visited London a number of times of the years and this was one of the things I was most looking forward to taking my son to see, everyone recognizes Big Ben and until you see it in person you don't realize how big it actually is. A must see for anyone visiting London
Just nice . It's in a very busy surrounding, so it's hard to actually take a photo if you're into that. It's kind of impressive, as it's really tall and all.
The heart of London. It is a must to pass by and check on this iconic building. From the pictures looks okay but when you see it with your eyes it is just wow

Big Ben . Absolutely amazing! We first saw Big Ben from Leicester Square then from the London Eye. It's worth a walk to see experience the actual size! It is overwhelming and the O'clock chimes were legendary. Well worth a visit to this iconic landmark.

Iconic Clock Tower!. Big Ben is probably the most recognized Clock Tower in the world. The tower is officially known as Elizabeth Tower, renamed in 2012 to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II. The tower holds the second largest four-faced chiming clock in the world (after Minneapolis City Hall). Its familiar ring is caused by a crack which appeared in 1859, within a few months of the bell being installed. The Elizabeth Tower and Great Bell have been scheduled for a major renovation, which is expected to last three years and is due to begin in early 2017. Essential maintenance will be carried out on the clock mechanism, which will be stopped for several months - during which there will be no chimes. Striking and tolling will however be maintained for important events. The 320' tower is the most enduring symbol of the British people. The famous chimes are still recognized throughout the world. I have been able to find out that the two times Big Ben was silent were for Prime Minister Sir Winston Churchill’s funeral in 1965 and for Baroness Margaret Thatcher’s funeral in 2013. The Elizabeth Tower is not open to the general public. However, UK residents can book a tour of Elizabeth Tower to see Big Ben. Free Exterior - Tube Station: Westminster

Normally only UK passport holders allowed, but .... An extraordinary treat, especially for clockmakers! Currently for security reasons the clock tower is open for UK members only. You'll have to come up with your own reasons why you want to see the clock if you don't have a UK passport. Just keep trying because it is an absolutely amazing icon and the UK government tour guide was truly an expert on the clock and tower history and the mechanics of the clock movement.

Perhaps as iconic to London as the Statue of Liberty is to New York.. Big Ben possibly is figuratively the heart of London and a symbol of political England. It is the bell tower of the Houses of Parliament that dominate Parliament Square. Big Ben's chimes signify the exact hour and the tower is illuminated at night if Parliament is sitting. Laid out in 1868 the Houses are an impressive work of architecture. However, the site also known as the Palace of Westminster, dates back to 1097. One portion - Westminster Hall - is open to visitors. With its hammerbeam roof it is considered one of the finest of Europe's medieval buildings. Big Ben itself is not open to the public. But, it is the jewel at the heart of some of London's most famed sites. It is also a must for any tourist with a camera.

Symbol of London!. How do you tell people that you are in London with only one picture? A picture of Big Ben will do!Technically, Big Ben is the name of the bell inside the Victoria Tower of the Westminster Palace, but technicality are for nerds! London has many iconic structures of old and new like the classic Tower Bridge and the modern London Eye, but even so, Big Ben remains THE symbol of London and even the whole UK.If you time properly, you can hear Big Ben's symbolic ring on every hour as well. It sounded like any other bell tower, but there's just something about the Big Ben sound that definitely rings in your ears!Getting in the tower itself is difficult because you have to be an UK citizen to file a reservation with your MP, but really, the gem is outside! If you want to make sure you aren't dreaming of landing in London, take the tube directly from the airport* and stop at Westminster station - The moment you get to ground level is the moment when you will definitely be convinced that you have arrived in the British capital! ---tl;dr version:1) THE symbol of London2) Tough to get in the actual tower but just check it out outside!3) See directly at the exit of Westminster tube station---FROM THE AIRPORT1) If you are riding on Piccadilly Line, transfer at Green Park to Jubilee Line for a next-stop ride to Westminster2) If you are riding on Heathrow Express or Connect, transfer to the London Underground's Circle Line directly to Westminster

Big Ben - London's famous landmark. London’s most famous landmark is situated at the north side of the Houses of Parliament. Elizabeth Tower is often mistakenly referred to as Big Ben – but it is the huge bell at the top of the tower which is named Big Ben. This bell has a weight of about 13,000 kilograms. The tower is over 150 years old. The nearest underground station to get to the tower is Westminster.The dial of the clock is about seven metres in diameter. The dial hands are about 4 metres long. It is an accurate clock that is regulated by a mechanism of weights and pendulums.Big Ben has survived the German bombings in the second World War. Each New Year’s Eve, thousands of people gather to hear the chimes bringing in the New Year.The Tower is not open to the public. It is due for a facelift starting in early 2017 – and so I would recommend that you visit Big Ben before the scaffolding goes up before the start of the refurbishment programme scheduled to last about three years.I think that the best place to view Big Ben is on Westminster Bridge approaching from the South Bank towards the Houses of Parliament.

Queen's Tour for Children- Worth It!. This is a review for a tour we took of Westminster (British Parliament Building). Americans cannot go up Queen's Tower to see Big Ben (bell inside the clock). I am happy to report post tour that we both have a clearer understanding of the intersection between the Monarchy and Parliament. Our tour, the Queen's Experience recreated the Queen's Opening of Parliament Ceremony. This tour is currently running limited weekends. Check the website to book tickets. The tour was an hour and the guide did a good job involving the kids in the group. I would recommend it.

Big Ben is Awesome. No matter how many times I visit London, Big Ben is always a sight I want to see. It represents English culture and steadfastness. Do not miss it!
Exactly like in the pictures. It is exactly what you expect. Pretty, tall and surrounded by people all the time. It is a must see if you're in London. And a must selfie! :D

Iconic and Beautiful.... Very few things say 'London' the way the Big Ben does. It is definitely worth stopping by for a quick visit. It's easy to get to by catching the tube to the Westminster station, and it is very interesting being able to read up on some interesting facts about Big Ben and the Elizabeth Tower. Unfortunately, I hear that Big Ben is due for a renovation in early 2017, which will last approximately three years!

Yet another must see in London. From the west townside Big Ben is mostly hidden and cannot easily be seen so you more or less happen to suddenly end up right in front of it, as happened to us first time we went to see it.Approaching from either across or along the Thame it can of course be spotted from quite a distance due to its unique look. I've already seen quite a lot of parliament buildings but each time I see Big Bena and the Houses of Parliament I continue to think that it is one of the most beauitiful ones in Europe. So coming here and having a look is of course a must, as well as is listening to its famous sound for the full hour. For taking pictures of Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament in one view I would recommend to do this from across the Thame or from one of the Bridges nearby. Best lighting would then be between sun rise and noon. In the afternoon you will have good lighting for a selfie just with the Big Ben from the west near the Churchill statue.
Beauty. The art of architecture, beauty.. the view & scenery is awesome.who so ever visit london must go for it...
The Icon of London. You need to visit there. Very convenient go to the tube station, talk to the ticker counter, they will assist you on the ticket.

Great place to visit. Big Ben is Big Ben, nothing to do but being there is a proud moment of personal achievement as being at and with the world iconic symbol. Cannot take the picture too close and not see much too far but so happy to be there. The whole compound is impressive and one must visit when in London. If you are an adventurous traveler, you need not buying tour ticket for these sights, take the "Underground" and get out at "Westminster Station". There it is you will find everything within walking distance of 10-20 minutes.

that is definitely the most touristic attraction ever. i am always surrounding this place because it is the most famous city in the world and I live just 5 minutes away from Big Bangthat is definitely the most touristic attraction ever When I travel here...honestly i have not limits...i can be around the Parliament any time any day .Visited n May 2016
Houses of Parliament visit. Good views from Westminster bridge and parliament squareOne of Londonderry most famous landmarksAlways worth a photo
A Memorable Site. When I visited the city, seeing this incredible and historic site always took my breath away. It should be viewed both during the da & evening.
Brilliant at telling the time. I couldn't find my watch... What a lifesaver - what would I have done without a 50 metre high clock?

A beautiful sight. Nice to hear the clock strike the hours. Houses of Parliament are attached so it is quite a sight. Read up on the history before you see it. An easy walk over Westminister bridge which is close by.

Iconic structure in London. Get off the Tube at Westminster, come up from the Underground and WOW, it hits you that you are looking at one of the most iconic buildings in the world, and certainly in London., Great to take photos by day or night and to hear the bell ring. Love it. Walk around the area surrounding Westminster Abbey, and check out the great sculptures while you are there of military heroes and people such as Sir Winston Churchill.
Glorious. I would say "go" but you can't miss it. Take time to read up on the history and stop and feel the moment at the base. Fabulous!
Big B. Beautiful place for the tourist whether it is day or night. The place is just beside the river Thames with a panoramic view.
Birthday Trip. We enjoyed the Big Ben my daughter was amazed by this historical marker! It's with in walking distance from Buckingham palace!

Outstanding. No trip to London will be complete without a trip to Big Ben. Stand across the street for the best pictures. West Minster Abby is across the street and you can also walk to the London Eye.
A Must to See While in London. I never dreamed how beautiful this area would be in person. Wow! Wow! Wow! You gotta come here and take lots of photos.

Iconic time piece. What fabulous architecture in the centre of a bustling part of London , so near to the British government, just looking at Big Ben gives a feeling of awe at the construction and its beauty and a sense of history at the location . A must see in London
Aight seeing . This was absolutely beautiful and even more incredible in person!!! As soon as you get off the train this is what you will see!
Good to sight!!. Nothing much to do here but you can appreciate the architecture of this place and get some photographs clicked for the album!! No doubt that this is an iconic place to see!!
looks awesome in the evening. It is just near to london eye and looks very good during evening time. very nice photo opportunity. nothing much to see.

Iconic and Impressive!. Big Ben (Elizabeth Tower) and the Houses of Parliament are an iconic and impressive architectural achievement. They were more impressive in person than I imagined them to be. In fact, being across the street from Westminster Abbey make that intersection possibly the most impressive of any city.

As fun as expected . We spent the afternoon walking around and admiring the architecture of the building.... Be ready to take a zillion Pics and help other fellow traveler from all over the world do the same!!
Big Ben. Great to see day or night..a must see when in London. And listen to the bell ringing....went and saw this on a tour
Stunning. Absolutely stunning. Also interesting to learn that the name Big Ben is not of the clock, but of the giant bell that tolls inside. Otherwise, the tower is known as Elizabeth Tower.

Spectacular by night. It was very beautiful by night, also one sight in London you should definitely see once in your lifetime. Specifics in all around the building is just something you can not describe until you see them yourself.

We came, we saw, we walked. We saw the Big Ben as we were walking from Chelsea. It is even more amazing in person than in any book or movie we've ever seen. Definitely worth getting up close and personal!
A MUST Visit. During the day is obviously the best experience, however with the tower floodlit at night, Big Ben gains an aura all of it's own.

Completes the London skyline. Big Ben is a spectacular view. From the river Thames you get excellent views, especially parliament bridge. You hear the bells ring out from all around London city. A must see when visiting London.

Impressive architecture . Yes it's a beautiful and striking piece of British heritage and well known landmark around the world but because of the government offices housed beneath it this is a landmark purely for they eyes only, no grand tours inside, this is great for individuals who enjoy photography learning about history and to see the sheer scale of the building but I'm a bit like a kid, a big kid, I'm also an engineer so I like getting in amongst things seeing the ins and outs, we really enjoyed sightseeing from the bus and boats but it's not really my thing and tbh I know when I bring my kids they're just going to go oh yeah mum were bored !

Incredible. You can't miss this iconic ! Huge and really incredible ! If you are lucky you can hear it and that's a great moment !! This monument is really close to Westminster station so really easy to reach it.It is also nice to have a walk from the London Eye, through the bridge till the Big Ben
Big tower and a clock. Big tower and a clock. Impressive building even whith the construction set on the westminster. Nice walk over the bridge.

Worth it. Wanted to come to England as a child, now to see this historic sight and its surroundings was fantastic. Our journey was mid year, and had no problems with crowds or asking locals for directions.

An Imposing Sight. Any visit to London should include a trip to see - and hear - Big Ben. Try to time your trip for 10, 11, or 12 to enjoy the full effects of Ben's stentorian bell tones. It is every bit as beautiful in person as it looks in its pictures.

Great view. Great thing to see this Big Ben. I thought it would be bigger than it is. Anyway, bear in mind you can't enter inside the building itself and see the Big Ben only from the outside. The bridge near the Big Ben is full of tourists that take photographs of the building. To the opposite side you can also see the London eye. Great place to see in London and you must se for yourself!
Cultural stroll round London town. It's been a few years, but when visiting with friends who haven't seen it, then it's a pleasure to revisit such wonderful landmarks.

Impressive monument !. Big Ben is so impressive ! As big as its name ! Its nice to see it from close so you can understand how big it is ! You can also hear it if you are lucky , i was ! Behind big ben is the British Parliament ! If you use the Westminster station is the first thing you will see in the stations exit !

Always big, always impressive.. What can you say about an icon of London! I did actually learn something this trip, they use old pennies on the pendulum to change the time. Who would have thought it. Not much so say really, stand back and marvel.
Cant Miss. If you're a tourist in London you wouldnt miss seeing this and the Houses of Parliament. It's awesome!!
Iconic!!. Did not get inside, but it is already beautiful from outside; especially during the night time. To me it is full of history and amazing!!
London icon. Please make sure you stop by this iconic London building when in town. Big Ben is just absolutely amazing and quite simply one of the best building experience in UK.

Amazing Decor and Massive Building. I was able to walk towards the building from Buckingham Palace and see the Clock and all the detail of the buildings. I went at the best time which was in the evening where the color of the building was seen with natural daylight and then when the light came on. Just Stunning

Big Ben is as big as they say. First, Big Ben is every bit as big as I expected. I don't understand reviewers who say it's small. Not sure what they envisioned. It's a beauty to the eye and ear. We just happened to arrive two minutes before noon, so we got the full Big Ben serenade, and it was amazing. Well worth the visit.

Its Big Ben.. What can you say? It's Big Ben. Best views from the other side of the bridge but the is a secret location which many people miss. If you are by the aquarium go under Westminster Bridge (not over it.) And just the other side, you get a classic photo viewpoint both day and night.

Wonderful and interesting place to see. Of course you can visit British parliament, full of history and fantastic rooms, painting and art in general. Palace is a working area and of course a security check is mandatory, but really it's good to visit . There will be no access to "Big Ben".
As seen on TV. it's really niice but the area is extremely crowded, I don't recommend going in the morning coz of the crowd.
Big Ben!! what can you say. Did not go in, don't know if you can. but Big Ben is a site to see. It's amazing to look at and a must see whilst in London.
Great trip. I always wanted to know what is inside in this building, and this amazing trip made my day more interesting and awesome

Amazing. You must visit this iconic place. It will leave you in awe.
Did look a little smaller then I had thought but the design was amazing.

Big Ben..and yes it is the clock!!. We have been suggested that Big Ben is a must visit if visiting London. We being not so good with the map and with lots of curiosity could reach only in the evening. The place is pretty good, you can really have some nice clicks nearby. Big Ben is really big and yes will suggest people to keep it on the list.
Historical moments. Simply just to be short ... it's history but if you feel tired of walking too much i recommend to take the river tour

you can visit inside BIG BEN tower. No need to be British,I am French , just being a resident is enough, ask your MP for an invitation/ free tour but you can also pay for it through some agencies charging £187 per person,beautiful and historic, its a must see!then you can take a secret corridor to take you to the tube station directly!no photos allowed unfortunatly

The Biggest of Bens!. A visit to London would be incomplete without a trip to the Houses of Parliament and the famous Big Ben. We visited at twilight and the colours were breathtaking as you can see from the accompanying photograph.

Beautiful Big Ben. Our kids have always been fascinated with Big Ben. They first discovered it in Peter Pan/Tinker bell and were amazed when we told them it was real. When we got to Westminster their jaw just dropped!!! They never expected it to be huge lol and it was magical every time the hourly chimes rang.The best time for pics are when the sun goes down and sky just paints itself. The tower looks brilliant when the lights come on.
Amazing to hear Big Ben chime every 15 minutes. To be in the shadow of Big Ben was a dream come true and to hear the hourly chime was great ! We even recorded it.
What a view. Always admire this piece of history when I pass through Westminster Bridge. It an iconic place very popular with visitors.

Third visit. This was my third visit to London. The last visit was 13 years ago. I always enjoy visiting Big Ben. This time I was able to take our youngest daughter for the first time. Marvelous time.

A must see. Big Ben is something you just have to see while visiting London. It is very central and easy to get to from pretty well anywhere in London. Just listening to the clock chime can send shivers up your spine . Great history!!!
Must see!. Don't leave London without seeing Big Ben from various locations ie) across from the River Thames, on the Golden Jubliee Bridges, London Bridge, and from the Parliament Square Garden.

Big Ben tour. Wow! Well what can you say. It was just brilliant to be able to climb the 334 steps up the Elizabeth Tower. Don't half make you feel dizzy though. When you get to the top get to walk behind all the clock faces see the mechanism that keeps it all ticking away. Then the big part comes when you get up into the belfry at the stroke of the hour and you are standing right infront of old BIG BEN himself. When it happens and the gongs go and the tune, with the rumble of the bell at the end. And the view it excellent looking down over London and the rest of parliament.Was AMAZING to see. You have got to be British to go up. Write to your local MP for the area you live in and get tickets. They are free. But you do have to get permission from your MP. Email them with your Name Address Postcode Phone numberAnd say you want to tour Big Ben. There are no toilets on the tour.No drink apart from water which is allowed. You need to be quite fit to do the climb there are no lifts up.  And no cameras or phones allowed either. But all in all it was a great thing to do and would recommend anyone to try it. As it is something you never see.
Amazing Big Ben. It is one of the most popular landscapes in the world. Either morning or night it is perfect to stop for a momento and stare at it. Take some photos and enjoy it.

Big Ol' Ben is Fantastic!. You can knock out several sites in one afternoon if you have the energy for it. Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, Parliament and the London Eye (among other things) are all relatively close together. This will also put you right next to the Thames River which is super cool. Big Ben lives up to it's name, it's massive! There's a good sized empty grass lot right across the way (next to the Churchill statue) that's a great area for photo snapping. If you're planning to be in central London, these sites are totally worth it!
Great picture at night. Make sure you see Big Ben both during the day as well as at night. It's very beautiful all lit up at night👍🏻
It is a most worthy visit.. Although you will not be able to take photos during most of the tour, I recommend a visit with audio guide, so you will control your pace.
what can i say " big ben". what a beautiful city London is with all there heritage. and did you know that big ben is the bell and not the tower
Big Ben is as impressive as you might imagine. It is worth the effort to get here. Get lots of photos after seeing the changing of the guard. It was a bit misty when I was here...unfortunately

Big Ben is not the official name; Ben is the big bell in the clock's tower. Took one of the many bus and boat tours of the historical sites in London. Will not disappoint to see all the well known sites we come to know from our studies in the U.S., however, one of the most informative small bit of info I found interesting was the story of the iconic tall tower's clock Big Ben ⏰ at the palace of Westminster. Maybe it is a very known story in England and the rest of Europe but Big Ben is not the official name! The history as well as value are priceless. The tower is offically known as the Elizabeth Tower renamed in 2012 former name the Clock Tower. For me it is as recognizable as NYC Statue of Liberty in the U.S. worthy of 5 stars⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
I cried.... I had dreamed for 20 years to be in England and when I came, THIS was the first thing I went to see... I was in tears of joy!

Great Big Ben and Elizabeth Tower - Not to be missed.. You can hear it well before you see it. The whole ambiance of the area is a amazing and there are so many attractions in close proximity. Westminster Abbey is 4 minutes walk as well and Scotland Yard is also close by. EnjoyIf you found this review useful please indicate below..
Wow . Amazing .... great place and very interesting great pictures ... a must see if in London xAnd right in the heart of Westminster
Classic London. Of course a classical site to visit and spend the time to explore its every angle for your photos shoots. Beautifcally ornate architecture that need to be seen up close.

Loved it wait for the chime. Loved seeing the piece of art. Be sure and wait for it to chime. It gorgeous from all sides. It can even be seen from Buckingham Palace. While your there be sure and your the Parliament, it's an excellent tour.

Take the tour. Big Ben is the name of the bronze clock inside. The tower is actually called the Elisabeth tower.
Fantastic from the outside. From Westminster bridge or the south bank.
Take the guided tour in the weekend in the palace of Westminster and you get to step into "big Ben"

Gorgeous. Much larger than imagined.. You can see the Elizabeth Tower as soon as you enter the Parliament area. It looms high in the skyline. Big Ben rings from inside the tower. It was much more beautiful than I imagined.

Tour of Houses of Parliament excellent.. We wanted to tour the Houses of Parliament and went there while touring London and purchased tickets for the next day. Fascinating history and an excellent tour. Would recommend it!

Impossible to miss. Even if you stay as a tourist in London for only one day this is THE monument to see. If you are lucky, enjoy it at night. Be also sure you have heard him because this is such a nice experience.
lovely place. very attractive and an icon for London which is a must see for all tourists! better to go at night for sure!
One of the most iconic structures in the world.. The title of my review says it all really. Surely something that one has to see with their own eyes at least once.

Symbolic of London.. Still haven't got around to arranging the tour - UK nationals are entitled to a free ascent on application to Parliament or through their Member of Parliament but have to wait several months - but it would be an experience to actually view the Great Bell, especially at noon when it sounds twelve times.Had another look at Elizabeth Tower, the stately and ornate home of the iconic bell and clock, from a riverboat and it looks as majestic as ever.

Most people who reviewed have never seen Big Ben, but we sure have heard him. Most people call the Elizabeth Tower Big Ben, but Big Ben is actually the bell housed inside the tower. There is something magical about hearing that bell toll the hours as you walk in the area. The Elizabeth Tower and the Houses of Parliament are one of the most recognized sites in the world. It is truly a beautiful building, and well worth walking around to admire the detail in the building. You can get great photos of the building from the Westminster Bridge and the London Eye.
Iconic and impressive. Great British iconic photo opportunity as soon as you exit Westminster station! Always impressive to see.

The Biggest Ben of Them All. I did not fully take advantage of this historic site but it is certainly great to see it there in it's sprawling environment with the Houses of Parliament and Westminster Abbey all in the same vicinity. I usually take guests to the Tate Modern and walk to Big Ben. Beware it is very crowded.
Very pretty!. It is stunning to look at, I'm an idiot though because i was standing in front of it and kept checking my phone for the time.
As iconic as it gets. Took the littles ones to Big Ben over half term holidays and it was a fantastic day out. Amazing architecture and iconic looks.

Great place to see. Definetally something to see whilst you are here. Why? It's got so much history behind it. It's a large clock tower that has stood for over 100 years. It's part and parcel to a visit for London. A must see (That and Parliament and Abbey are close, 3 birds 1 stone).

Wow. As good as we all know how this attraction is, it's much much better once you are right next to it! All the Big Ben chimes on New year's day came ringing in my ears and made me so happy. Can't believe I never went closer to it, my kids were in heaven.

Definitely a must do! . Big Ben is like the most iconic landmark of London and has to be visited if travelling to London. Seeing it in all its glory is another thing. Being next to the River Thames makes it easy to get to by boat or view by boat if you go on a boat tour. A great attraction and one I enjoyed viewing.
Nice view. This place makes me fell very good and relaxed but speciale in the night when it's a bit quite and london trafic is not to high.
Awesome sight. This is really lovely. Saw it from outside and I was really amazed and happy it stood the test of time. It is an icon everyone visiting London must see. It is really beautiful.
Such a wonderful sight to see and to hear. We saw Big Ben on our London Cab Tour and learned so much about the history or it and the surrounding area, loved hearing it!
It takes my breather away. I lived in London for 13 years, and every time I passed by, It would take my breathe away, is so beautifully British, at night it really shines, I love it!!!
Nice view|. Need to be there to see the Big Ben greatness! Only take a few minutes but i recommend. Only visit by day but at night must be a good choice.
Big B. Very fun seeing it at night. It's so busy in London and seeing it on the London Eye was amazing, makes you love the city.

Always Spectacular Photo Op. Not true that once you've seen it no need to go back.

A must see site for any walkabout. You definitely need to see Big Ben. Its the hallmark site.

Stunning. I been to London a lot and I have seen this so many times, but never fails to amaze me. It is definitely worth going to see. Amazing.
Nice. We had just walked by me and my husband we are not even sure if you can visit inside of it. But quite a sight to be seen.
British Ben. Truly amazing, Big Ben is one of the worthwhile heritage to visit in London. Views from West Minster Bridge and London Eye of Big Ben are great.
Stunning . The Big Ben is stunning by far and up close, the architecture is insane, a must see while in London. Walking distance from The London Eye.
Walk by Big Ben. This stunning landmark sees more people taking pictures than admiring its stunning architecture with awe

Awesone iconic building. On my second visit to London I still admire the very nice Parliament buildings and the iconic big Ben.
It is in my opinion a must do new years eve location. Although I visited this time in June I could only remembered the awesome time that I had in the new years eve 2014.
Totally recommend it.
Beautiful at night. Better to go their at night, Does not take much time to see the place (1 hr max, 30 mins typically). So plan for several other place to stop by when you travel to see Big Ben
Iconic. It's such a central thing to see Big Ben and the Parliament House next to it. Really easy to find, can't spend too much time looking at a clock but a must do touristy thing in London

It;s Big Ben..... You know your at Westminster when you see the clock. It is pretty and it is London, a must see. Of course this is one of the main attractions, so get ready for the masses, very crowded area.
A true icon of London. Upon exiting Westminster station, this is what first hits you....a magnificent site, and you know your are London Town !

Iconic. Everytime I am in London, Big Ben is something which cannot be missed. Defines the city as much as any other landmark. Surrounded by so many important landmarks which can be covered within a day.

Amazing! A must see while in London. Can't get enough pictures of Big Ben, it really is an amazing monument to see and photograph. After all it's free. No you can't really visit the inside but to be on the outside for us to take pictures was enough. Here you can walk across the bridge to London Eye and many other tourist attractions.
Tour Stop. A great photo op right at the Westminster Tube stop. No trip to London is complete without this mandatory stop. Nothing to go in and see, just a great landmark.

Good to see in the flesh. This was another icon that I finally got to see in the flesh. Due to time constraints I was only able to see it from across the road while in the line for Westminster Abbey, but I was still awestruck.
A site to see. Walk around parliament, westminster abbey and cathedral or cross westminster bridge. Take a Thames cruise or a bus tour. Hop off to see Big Ben for yourself and take a few pics!
See it and move on. See it, take a picture of it, move on. I love when attractions are so easy to check off my list! FYI, Big Ben is actually the name of the bell inside, not the tower.

TICK' TICK`TICK. Camera worthy in a tourist section...with most sights nearby.
Good tourist JUNK shopping.....across the street from Westminster Abbey

A must to see!. You can't miss it! I believe it's the first place you have to visit while in London.
Enjoy watching at it from different points of view and with different lights condition.
The characteristic of LONDON. The most known attraction in London. We waited many hours to see it lighting . Until 21.30 it wasnt so my child left dissapointed

Timing is everything. This is a must see on anyone's visit to London. The history and majesty of this towering clock that has withstood world war stands as a monument to the British people and the world.
Good photo opportunity. Walked over the bridge to get a good photo of Big Ben. I really enjoy this area of London, there is a nice atmosphere, a mix of tourists and people on business.

A Bell of History. We took the tour of the Elizabeth II Tower. Amazing! Full of wonderful facts. Lots of stairs. To stand next to Big Ben as it chimes - incredible. This tour only available to UK residents via your local MP. Next onto Palace of Westminster. Did audio tour - pitched just right for kids and adults. snake like tour so you don't miss anything. Best to visit when Parliament is in recess as you get to walk into the Commons Chamber and the Lords chamber - wonderful experience. The whole Palace is full of great works of art and is a must do visit. Great coffee shop and gift shop too.

a must see. when you come to London you just have to go see Big Ben. when we went to Big Ben we hear the clock because the clock was 7 and it hit 7 times, so i reccomend that you go there at a time you can hear the clock.

It wouldn't be London without it!. An imposing building - standing there on the banks of the Thames so proudly. Surrounded by the Houses of Parliament on one side and Westminster Abbey on the other. I've yet to meet the person who has gone to London that hasn't come home with a pic of Big Ben. But the best place to take a pic of this area is on the London Eye. Yep, grab a ticket let the wheel go around until its at its zenith, (approx 15 mins into the ride), and then take your pic. You'll have the most fantastic shot of all that I've mentioned. It really is worth the price of the Eye's ride. A Kodak moment if ever there was one
Rang right at noon. We happened to be in Parliament Square right at noon while visiting Westminster Abbey and the Supreme Court, and it rang right on time!
More stunning than anticipated. Well worth the trip. Convenient off the Westminster tube station. Beautiful landmark. And great location to also visit Westminster abbey and parliament buildings.
Big Ben. It's very congested with traffic so the best way to see it is from afar or just across the river! Fortunately we had dry weather even though it was very hot!
Classic London. When you think about London, you picture Big Ben in the background. Conveniently located near all the other attractions.
My favorite!. I loved looking at the Tower & Big Ben - something about it just makes it seem magical and so beautiful! I took a lot of pictures of it!
London the most amazing city in the world. Love London, love big ben & just love the history it has to offer. Big ben and the surrounding area of the Southbank is just WOW.
Big Ben ?!?. Would have missed it if we hadn't looked it up. Should see at night for something more spectacular. We were expecting more ...I guess?!?

London's Icon. Out of all the landmarks in the world, Big Ben is one that won't disappoint. It looks exactly like it does in the pictures. You can get some great photos atop the pedestrian bridge as you approach the landmark (even better when you can catch a red double decker bus whizzing by in the background)! As striking in the daytime as it is at night, no visit to London is complete without taking a gander at this huge tower.

Beautiful!. I recommend taking the Tube to the Westminster station. It makes for a great presentation when you walk out of the Tube and there is the Tower of Big Ben looming overhead. It is truly lovely! Also, try to time your visit to hear the chiming of the bells. You won't be sorry!
Beautiful in person. Heard these bells in my grandparents homes from their mantle clocks. Finally heard the REAL thing. You will take pictures of Ben from every angle. MUST SEE!
Worth a look.. Get the tube to Westminster and when you walk out of the station there it is. Fun Fact. Big Ben is not the name of the tower, it's actually the name of the bell inside the tower.

Always smaller than I think. Always good to see or hear as she strikes because the noise is so famous around the world. However personally I am always a little underwhelmed by the actual size of Big Ben which compared to the Houses of Parliament always seems a little lacking for its title. Still a worthwhile sight to see though whilst visiting London.

World's most famous clock . After years and years of seeing Big Ben in photos and movies and on TV, I finally got to see it in person and it lives up to expectations. It's an amazing piece of architecture and engineering. All those pictures you see Big Ben in doesn't do it justice because it's absolutely huge when you see it in person. A must visit place in London simply because it's an icon.
Beautiful place.. Beautiful view by the river thames.specially when standing just on the bridge.easy to get in to the area by bus or train.
Beautiful architecture!. Beautiful building, great location with nice views. Love those street performers and the "peanut guys" over the bridge!
Be there for the bell toll. It's beauty is one thing, hearing the bell toll is another. Not much to do other than enjoy its beauty, but how can you not if you're in London

An Icon In London. Access is via Westminster Station on the District (Green) or Central (Yellow) Lines.

Big Ben with a Queen's Walk to London Eye & Madame Tussauds. I visited the 96m tall clock tower Big Ben last summer, and it was amazing! I love the fact that when you visit Big Ben there is a 6 minutes long walk called '' The Queen's Walk '' where you not only get to visit England's most famous tourist attraction, but you also with only a 6 minutes walk get to visit the world wide famous London Eye where you can experience a great view over the beautiful city of London. Visiting London was really amazing since in the time of around 5 hours I got to experience 2 world wide known tourist attractions, and also got to visit Madame Tussauds that is close to London Eye and is a famous building with wax dolls of different famous people. That is the favorite thing I enjoyed about London, in almost the same place you get to visit 3 wonderful places & also during the Queen's Walk there are a lot of tasty snacks you can buy that I otherwise can't because I live in Sweden.It was a great experience, and I would really recommend it to anyone if you're traveling with friends, couples or family it gives you a great experience either way for not a lot of money.

hourly ringing of the Big Ben. The most iconic image of London must to be visited without fail. Everything about this structure ....from the hour indicating bell to the beauty of the architecture of this famous monument is awe inspiring.

Iconic Site that every traveler to London must see. I still remember the first time I saw the Big Ben clock tower up close. Each time we visit London we make a point to walk by the Big Ben area frequently.The other good news is that it is so close to many other sites in London, so you have not gone out of your way to be part of this experience.

Big Ben : Dominion over time in London. From the Parliament Square under Churchill, Gandhi, Mandela, Lloyd George and others statues, we observed Big Ben dominating the sky in Westminster on a golden Elisabeth Tower. Indeed, the time stops to watch Big Ben clock heavy hands running slowly. Hurry up! Hurry up! Just near, in Parliament Street, the double-decker bus #88 is waiting for carrying you far away to Camden multicoloured shops. Don’t mind to the young boy near the bus driver showing him its latest best grades in mathematics: perhaps he is the future mayor of London, perhaps …

One of those boxes you have to tick. It is what it is. But, if you are a U.K. resident you can actually get a guided tour. Being an Aussie, I missed out. But it still makes for the most recognisable photo opportunity in London.

Worth the look. It is a beautiful building and definitely worth the trip to have a look. Be prepared for the street to be very busy as it is near a number of other attractions but you can get some really good photos from any places near by.

A must if your visiting London!. If your visiting London for the first time or your returning, no visit is complete without stopping by Big Ben. Your can hear the bells chime every hour. London trip. Great time in London. Too much people during this month. Need to watch for personal belongings and need to watch the kids.

Most elegant and beautiful monument. One cannot miss this wonderful monument while roaming in London. One of the land mark of London. It is very elegant and conspicuous in the area of westminster. An old monument which still attracts lot of tourists from all over the world.
Ok Place. Its a good monument but nothing spectacular about it. Just hyped as a must place to visit. They should allow visitors to go at top of Big Ben
Great sight to see. you have to see Big Ben and the houses of parliament when visiting London. Get a photo on the bridge with Big Ben in the background and you have your London shot.

One of the world's most famous landmarks - an icon of a magnificent world metropolis!. Some buildings are iconic for the city and the country they are in - the Eiffel Tower, the Pyramids of Giza, the Statue of Liberty in New York and the Sydney Opera House - to name a few. Big Ben belongs among the most well-British buildings imaginable and considering how many years (157 years!) As its carillon has rung of the city ... Personally, I always think of Sherlock Holmes or Film Noir figure during the Cold war days, when I see the clock tower. Big Ben is the Chime Not The Clock. I have been to London many times and each time I go to this wonderful city I find myself near Big Ben! Most people mistakenly think that the clock is Big Ben but it's actually the bell chime that sounds the hour itself that is Big Ben, nicknamed after the man who designed it. This clock tower is one of the most iconic sights in London and it does not disappoint. It's located adjacent to Westminster Abby and the Queen's Horse Guards, as well as other iconic London sights. The best part is it does not cost even a pound to get your photo taken with this London landmark in the background behind you and it's a great landmark to visit Rain or Shine! Just make sure you have your rain gear if it's wet out when you go. Big Ben is right off of the Westminster Tube Station and you can plan a trip to visit it in conjunction with a trip to Westminster Abby or The Queen's Horse Guards. Your can't visit London without hearing the iconic bell chime ring out, so make time to see this great landmark of London History! You can even get to it from any of the Hop On / Hop Off Bus Tours. Ben will put a smile on your face and make you want to come back to hear the amazing sound that comes bellowing out again and again!

Worth seeing from the outside - but UK citizens can climb the tower and see the bells!. Big Ben is a symbol of London and of Britain. It's a beautiful clock tower that is worth seeing even if that's just visitng Parliament Square and taking it in, as well as the house and Westminster Abbey. However, if you're a UK resident you can arrange to actually climb Elizabeth Tower (which is the tower where Big Ben - the bell - resides). You just need to find your MP online and write to them to request tickets and they will arrange this for you. When you finally get offered tickets it can be some months away which is worth bearing in mind, but don't let that get in the way of you having this unique rare opportunity to stand literally on the inside of the four clock faces and to be right by Big Ben and the other bells when they chime - you are given ear protectors but the chime goes right through your body. It's certainly something to consider.

Common misunderstanding. I just want to clarify that 'Big Ben', as iconic a symbol of London that it is, is NOT the clock tower itself. This is a very common misunderstanding. The tower is the Elizabeth Tower. Big Ben is actually the 13-ton bell inside the tower that rings out the hours. Big Ben first rang across Westminster on 31 May 1859. That said, the Palace at Westminster and the Elizabeth Tower is not to be missed and is best appreciated at night.

Big Ben Clock and Tower. Plus, it's magical if you're standing right there when you hear it chime, either at the top of the hour or on the quarter hour. It's a deep, resonant sound, reassuring in its nature. While many people think of the entire structure as Big Ben, the name really applies to the bell in the belfry. An instantly recognizable symbol of London, you can spy Big Ben from any number of vantage points in the city, both close up or far away. But, you owe it to yourself to view it up close to get a sense of its scale and to see some of the details of the clock and tower.
